trans-unit.source: Describes the appearance of a list item's bullet style.
The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.List.MarkerStyle%2A> property of a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.List> can be used to define the bullet style for each item in the list.
The bullet style can be a graphic element or an alpha-numeric value.
A solid square box is displayed.
A hollow disc circle is displayed.
A decimal is displayed, starting with the number one, for example, 1, 2, and 3.
The <xref href="System.Windows.TextMarkerStyle"></xref> is automatically incremented for each item added to the list.
A solid disc circle is displayed.
A lowercase [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ascii](~/includes/tlasharptla-ascii-md.md)] character is displayed, starting with the letter a, for example, a, b, and c.
The <xref href="System.Windows.TextMarkerStyle"></xref> is automatically incremented for each item added to the list.
A lowercase Roman numeral is displayed, starting with the numeral i, for example, i, ii, iii, and iv.
The <xref href="System.Windows.TextMarkerStyle"></xref> is automatically incremented for each item added to the list.
A hollow square shape is displayed.

An uppercase [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ascii](~/includes/tla2sharptla-ascii-md.md)] character is displayed, starting with the letter A, for example, A, B, and C. The <xref href="System.Windows.TextMarkerStyle"></xref> is automatically incremented for each item added to the list.
An uppercase Roman numeral is displayed, starting with the numeral I, for example, I, II, III, and IV.
The <xref href="System.Windows.TextMarkerStyle"></xref> is automatically incremented for each item added to the list.
